page.title: 01General review of the block
page.content: The block covering our area consists mainly of farmland. Some of it cultivated but most of it not. Probably 80|85% of the block then is fields. The most notable building in the block is Thurnham Hall,a small stately home dating from 13C. Another building of note is Ellel Hall,a large house privately occupied. Apart from farmhouses,the only other houses of note are about 20 bungalows forming a small estate near to the village of Glasson Dock. Also in the block is our school and the village church. A notable feature is the yacht basin,a stretch of water used for sailing and also where people actually live on boats.By the basin is a large building where boats of all kinds are maintained and repaired.A junction of the Lancaster canal runs through the block and terminates in the yacht basin.
